Context:
Program Name: Acting for Media
Code: P107
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $6,212.00
International Tuition: $19,248.00
Method of Study: Full-time
Location: St. James Campus
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Media & Performing Arts
Program Description: Acting training needed to succeed as a screen actor for various media (film, television, online, game or interactive mediums). Includes acting technique, movement, voice and script analysis. Provides on-camera experience, audition etiquette and standards. (Disclaimer: Professionalism, group work, intimacy between actors, whispering, consensual touching, combat training, expressions of physicality, deep exploration of self, personal psychological examination, conflict, and successful failure are expected.)
Code(s) for related programs: P104, P707, P108
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Acting for Media Program P107 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text discusses a acting program offered at one of Canada's Top 20 Acting Schools. Students will receive training in various acting techniques, voice-over work, motion capture, and new technology like phonography and immersive environments. Enrollment is competitive with limited spots available, and students need to maintain passing grades in acting and a minimum academic standing to progress to the next semester.

Career opportunities include being an Actor/Actress, Film Dubber, Voice-over Actor, Narrator, Dramatic Reader, and other roles across multiple platforms such as film, television, interaction storytelling, motion capture for gaming and animation, and voice-over for narration or dubbing. Graduates can apply to join ACTRA within one year of graduating as an Apprentice member. Students may also consider further study in the Screenwriting & Narrative Design graduate certificate program.

Required courses during Semester 1 include ACTS 1000: Basics of Acting, ACTS 1001: Movement I, ACTS 1002: Actor as Artist I, ACTS 1003: Speech I, ACTS 1004: Improvisation, VDES 1000: Mise-en-Scène & Film Structures, and COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts.

No specific years or emails were mentioned in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Acting for Media Program P107 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides a list of courses offered in semesters 1, 2, 3, and 4 for the Acting program at the college, along with their prerequisites. Here is the extracted information:

Semester 1:

  - Successful completion of all semester one courses
- ACTS 1012: Actor as Artist II
  - Successful completion of all semester one courses

  - Successful completion of all semester one courses
- ACTS 1014: Meisner Technique
  - Successful completion of all semester one courses

  - Successful completion of all semester one courses

Semester 2:

  - Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of all semester two courses
- ACTS 2002: Character Study
  - Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of all semester two courses
- ACTS 2003: Speech III
  - Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of all semester two courses
- ACTS 2006: Business Skills for Actors
  - Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of all semester two courses

  - Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of all semester two courses
- General Education Elective in SEMESTER 3

Semester 3:
- ACTS 2005: Audition Techniques
  - Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of all semester three courses

  - Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of all semester three courses

Context:
The graduate of this acting program at George Brown College is expected to demonstrate various abilities including presenting themselves for employment as a professional actor, creating and developing characters, conveying and sustaining truth of character using relevant technical skills, collaborating with industry professionals, preparing materials showcasing their skills, performing the activity required for the character, and employing improvisational skills.

The tuition fees for this program are as follows:
- Domestic students: $6,212.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2022)
- International students: $19,248.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2023)

There is a $50 audition fee payable in cash or money order only on the day of the audition.

This program is approved for OSAP funding for students who meet eligibility criteria.

Academic requirements include an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, and a grade 12 English (C or U). Applicants must also go through an audition process.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Acting for Media Program P107 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
* The number of qualified applicants during the application cycle is not explicitly stated in the text.
* All applicants who meet the academic requirements will receive an audition appointment and are required to present one monologue and one scene from pre-selected choices set out by the College, which must be memorized. Applicants can contact media@georgebrown.ca for the selection of scenes and include their George Brown student ID number.
* Mature students (19 years of age or older and no OSSD) may take the Admissions Assessment for English or consider upgrading to achieve the required credits in English. Students who start the program in January (winter term) will be required to attend classes during the summer months (May to August).
* Course exemptions are available based on college or university credits, and applicants can visit the Transfer Guide for more information.
* International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements. They may also contact international recruitment representatives for information and to book a virtual meeting or submit an inquiry.
* The program is offered through the School of Media and Performing Arts, and classes take place at the St. James Campus located at 230 Richmond Street East, Toronto, Ontario, Canada. On-campus information sessions are available, and campus tours are offered on a regular basis. Interested individuals can sign up for an upcoming session or check out the virtual tour.
* Applicants may contact the School of Media & Performing Arts at 416-415-5000, ext. 2015 or email media@georgebrown.ca for more information about the college. They can also call the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002 for additional information. International students can contact one of the international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Acting for Media Program P107 | George Brown College2023.txt
